head.supplied: 19/9/94 ¶ ¶ Your bryologic collection has arrived, ¶ dear Mr Musson, and you shall have their names-list, so soon as the examination shall have been done, which however will take some time. It would...

div.p: ML MSS.2009/21, item 27, Linnean Society of NSW, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

proofed.
MS is accompanied by an envelope. The front is marked: ' On Her Majesty's Sevice
. | Ch T. Musson Esq | FLS., Lecturer at the | Hawkesb. Agric. | College | Richmond | near | Sydney. | Government Botanist , Melbourne, 19/9/1894.' The front also bears the stamp and crest of the Chief Secretary of Victoria and is date stamped Melbourne, 20 September 1894. The back is date stamped Richmond and Sydney both on 21 September 1894. 19/9/94

Your bryologic collection has arrived,
See also M to C. Musson, 4 and 17 September 1894. dear Mr Musson, and you shall have their names-list, so soon as the examination shall have been done, which however will take some time. It would be particularly pleasing to me, if on future occasions you could kindly secure 2 sets for me, as I could then retain one set here for the great herbarium, which I commenced in 1839, and have then also one set available for a leading Bryologist in Europe.
About one fifth of the mosses, now received, are without fruit. Perhaps you can find some of these yet in fruit hereafter.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd. von Mueller
MS is accompanied by one of M's herbarium labels: PHYTOLOGIC MUSEUM OF MELBOURNE. | Hawkesbury River 1894. Ch. T. Musson | BARON FERD. VON MUELLER, PH. & M.D., LL.D.
There are scratchy marks in a line on the label, has a name been deleted?
